steps.title: 1. Block All Channels
steps.description: Use your bank's mobile app or SMS codes to block Debit/Credit cards and Netbanking access immediately.

steps.title: 2. Report to Cybercrime
steps.description: Call 1930 or log on to cybercrime.gov.in. Keep your transaction details (UTR/Ref No) ready.

steps.title: 3. Notify Your Bank
steps.description: Inform your bank's fraud department within 3 days. This is critical for RBI's 'Zero Liability' protection.

prevention.tip: Enable SMS and Email alerts for all transactions.
Set transaction limits for online and international usage.
Never share OTP, PIN, or CVV with anyone calling as 'Bank Staff'.

rbi_rules.title: Zero Liability
rbi_rules.description: If you report an unauthorized transaction within 3 working days, you have zero liability. The bank must credit the amount back within 10 days.

rbi_rules.title: Limited Liability
rbi_rules.description: If reported within 4-7 working days, your liability is limited (usually up to 5,000 to 25,000 depending on account type).

hub_kyc.json.header_note: Know Your Customer (KYC) is a mandatory process for all financial services in India. Here is the list of documents required for various categories.
hub_kyc.json.important_note: Banks may ask for additional documents depending on specific cases. Always carry original documents for verification.

items.name: NREGA Job Card
items.description: Duly signed by an officer of the State Government

items.name: Utility Bills
items.description: Electricity, Telephone, Post-paid mobile, Piped gas, Water bill (not older than 2 months)

items.name: PPO Order
items.description: Pension or family pension payment orders issued by Govt

items.name: Allotment Letter
items.description: Accommodation from Central/State Govt, Statutory/Regulatory bodies

items.name: Guardian KYC
items.description: OVDs of the parent/guardian are required

hub_rbi_rules.json.header_note: RBI frequently updates master directions for banking services. Here are the core protections every depositor should know.
hub_rbi_rules.json.disclaimer: This information is summarized from RBI's 'Customer Service' guidelines. For official legal text, always refer to the RBI Master Circulars.

items.title: Banking Ombudsman
items.content: If your bank does not resolve your complaint within 30 days, you can approach the RBI Banking Ombudsman. It is a free and official channel for grievance redressal.

items.title: Deposit Insurance (DICGC)
items.content: Each depositor in a bank is insured up to a maximum of 5,00,000 (five lakhs) for both principal and interest amount held by them in the same capacity and same right.

items.title: Zero Liability for Fraud
items.content: You have zero liability for unauthorized electronic transactions if you report them to the bank within 3 working days of the occurrence.

items.title: Bank Locker Liability
items.content: Banks are liable for an amount equivalent to 100 times the prevailing annual rent of the safe deposit locker in case of fire, theft, or building collapse.

hub_security_tips.json.header: Stay safe from phishing and online scams by following these best practices recommended by cybersecurity experts and banks.

items.title: Verify Official URLs
items.content: Always double-check the URL in the browser address bar. Phishing sites often use slightly misspelled names like "sbi-bank.net" instead of "onlinesbi.sbi".

items.title: Avoid Sponsored Links
items.content: Search results often show "Sponsored" ads at the top. These are frequently used by scammers. Always scroll down to the organic search results or use verified directories.

items.title: Protect Your OTP & PIN
items.content: Bank staff will never ask for your OTP, CVV, or Login Password. If someone asks for these details over a call or message, it is a scam.

items.title: Use Official Apps Only
items.content: Download banking apps only from official stores (Google Play or Apple App Store). Avoid side-loading apps or clicking on "update" links sent via SMS.

hub_templates.json.helper: You can copy or share these pre-filled templates for various banking requests. Replace the [bracketed] fields with your actual details.

items.title: Account Closure Request
items.subject: Request for Closure of Bank Account - [Account Number]
items.body:
To,
The Branch Manager,
[Bank Name],
[Branch Name]

Subject: Request for closure of my Savings Account No: [Account Number]

Respected Sir/Madam,

I am maintaining a savings account with your branch (A/c No: [Account Number]). Due to personal reasons, I am unable to maintain this account further and would like to request its permanent closure.

Please find enclosed my unused cheque book, debit card, and passbook for cancellation. I request you to transfer the remaining balance in this account to my other bank account mentioned below via NEFT/IMPS.

Beneficiary Name: [Your Name]
Bank Name: [Other Bank Name]
IFSC Code: [Other IFSC]
Account Number: [Other Account Number]

Thanking you,

Yours faithfully,

[Your Name]
Mobile: [Your Mobile Number]
Date: [Current Date]

items.title: Stop EMI Auto-Debit (NACH)
items.subject: Request to Stop Auto-Debit/NACH for Loan Account - [Loan Number]
items.body:
To,
The Branch Manager,
[Bank Name],

Subject: Instructions to stop auto-debit (NACH) for Loan A/c: [Loan Number]

Respected Sir/Madam,

I have an ongoing loan with your bank (Loan A/c No: [Loan Number]). I would like to request you to stop the monthly auto-debit (NACH/ECS) instructions for the EMI payment from my linked Savings Account [Savings A/c Number] effective from [Start Month/Date].

I will be making the future payments manually/via an alternative method as discussed with the loan department. Kindly confirm the cancellation of the mandate.

Thanking you,

Yours faithfully,

[Your Name]
Date: [Current Date]

items.title: Report Unauthorized Transaction
items.subject: Immediate Action: Unauthorized Transaction in Account [Account Number]
items.body:
To,
The Nodal Officer/Branch Manager,
[Bank Name],

Subject: Reporting of unauthorized transaction of Rs. [Amount] on [Date]

Respected Sir/Madam,

I am writing to report an unauthorized transaction that occurred in my account/card on [Date] at [Time]. I have not authorized or initiated this payment.

Transaction Details:
- Amount: [Amount]
- Date & Time: [Date/Time]
- Ref No/UTR: [Ref Number]

I have already blocked my card/net-banking through the mobile app/customer care. As per RBI guidelines on Zero Liability, I am reporting this within 3 days of the occurrence. Kindly investigate and reverse the amount to my account.

Attached is the screenshot of the transaction alert and the complaint filed on the Cybercrime portal.

Thanking you,

Yours faithfully,

[Your Name]
Mobile: [Your Mobile Number]
Date: [Current Date]

items.title: Update/Add Nominee
items.subject: Request to Update/Add Nominee for Account - [Account Number]
items.body:
To,
The Branch Manager,
[Bank Name],
[Branch Name]

Subject: Request to update/add nominee for Savings A/c No: [Account Number]

Respected Sir/Madam,

I wish to add/update the nominee for my savings account (A/c No: [Account Number]). Below are the details of the nominee:

Nominee Name: [Nominee Name]
Relationship with Account Holder: [Relationship]
Nominee Age: [Nominee Age]
Nominee Address: [Nominee Address]

Kindly update your records and provide me with an acknowledgement of this request.

Thanking you,

Yours faithfully,

[Your Name]
Mobile: [Your Mobile Number]
Date: [Current Date]

items.title: Reactivate Dormant Account

items.body:

[Bank Name],
[Branch Name]

My savings account (A/c No: [Account Number]) has been inoperative for over 2 years and is currently marked as 'Dormant'. I wish to reactivate this account for regular operations.

I am enclosing a self-attested copy of my KYC documents (Aadhaar/PAN) for verification. Please let me know if any further formalities or a fresh deposit is required to complete the process.

Thanking you,

Yours faithfully,

[Your Name]
Mobile: [Your Mobile Number]

items.title: Request for Loan NOC
items.subject: Request for No Objection Certificate (NOC) for Closed Loan A/c - [Loan Number]
items.body:

The Loan Department,
[Bank Name],

Subject: Request for NOC and Return of Original Documents for Loan A/c: [Loan Number]

Also, please return my original documents submitted during the loan application (e.g., Sale Deed, RC, etc.) and remove the hypothecation/lien from the records.

Thanking you,

Yours faithfully,

[Your Name]
Mobile: [Your Mobile Number]
Date: [Current Date]

[Bank Name],
[Branch Name]

Subject: Request to update communication address for A/c No: [Account Number]

Respected Sir/Madam,

I am maintaining a savings account with your branch (A/c No: [Account Number]). I have recently shifted my residence and would like to update my communication address in your records.

New Address:
[New Full Address]
City: [City]
PIN Code: [PIN Code]

I am enclosing a self-attested copy of [Address Proof Type] as proof of my new address. Kindly update the same and send a confirmation.

Thanking you,

Yours faithfully,

[Your Name]
Mobile: [Your Mobile Number]
Date: [Current Date]

items.title: Periodic KYC Update
items.subject: Submission of Documents for Periodic KYC Update - [Account Number]
items.body:
To,
The Branch Manager,
[Bank Name],
[Branch Name]

Subject: Periodic KYC update for my A/c No: [Account Number]

Respected Sir/Madam,

As per the bank's requirement for periodic KYC update, I am submitting the following self-attested documents for your records:

1. Identity Proof: [ID Proof Name]
2. Address Proof: [Address Proof Name]
3. Recent Photograph

There is no change in my current communication address / I have provided the updated address above. Kindly update my KYC status to ensure uninterrupted operations of my account.

Thanking you,

Yours faithfully,

[Your Name]
Mobile: [Your Mobile Number]
Date: [Current Date]

items.title: Loan Prepayment Intimation
items.subject: Intimation of Part-Prepayment for Loan Account - [Loan Number]
items.body:
To,
The Loan Department,
[Bank Name],

Subject: Intimation of part-prepayment of Rs. [Amount] for Loan A/c: [Loan Number]

Respected Sir/Madam,

I wish to make a part-prepayment of Rs. [Amount] towards my [Loan Type] (A/c No: [Loan Number]).

I request you to adjust this amount towards the principal balance. Please let me know the effect on my future EMIs or the reduction in loan tenure after this payment. I am attaching the payment proof / cheque for your reference.

Thanking you,

Yours faithfully,

[Your Name]
Mobile: [Your Mobile Number]
Date: [Current Date]

items.title: Escalation to Nodal Officer
items.subject: Escalation: Unresolved Complaint Ref No - [Complaint Ref]
items.body:
To,
The Principal Nodal Officer,
[Bank Name],

Subject: Escalation regarding unresolved complaint (Ref No: [Complaint Ref])

Respected Sir/Madam,

I am writing to escalate a grievance that remains unresolved despite my previous complaint to the branch/customer care on [Initial Date] (Reference No: [Complaint Ref]).

Issue Details:
[Describe issue briefly]

Since it has been over [Number of Days] days without a satisfactory resolution, I am approaching your office for intervention as per the bank's grievance redressal policy.

I hope for a prompt resolution. If not resolved within the next 15 days, I will be compelled to approach the RBI Banking Ombudsman.

Thanking you,

Yours faithfully,

[Your Name]
Mobile: [Your Mobile Number]
Date: [Current Date]

deposits.title: Deposits
deposits.deduction_day_info: Leave blank to auto-use the acquisition date day.
deposits.track_interest_info: Recommendation: Avoid treating savings account interest as fixed monthly income  with slab-based rates that can change anytime and based on balances. Since balances are volatile with frequent cash flows, the actual interest varies.
deposits.monthly_estimate_info: Monthly income is estimated; actual crediting may vary.
deposits.pomis_tenure_info: POMIS tenure is 5 years. Maturity date is acquisition date + 60 months.
deposits.pomis_tenure_with_date: POMIS tenure is 5 years. Inferred maturity date: {{date}}
deposits.nsc_info: NSC is cumulative; interest is paid at maturity.
deposits.kvp_suggestion: Suggested: ~{{months}} months to double at current rate.
deposits.kvp_info: KVP is cumulative; interest is realized via maturity value. Choose a maturity date; tenure varies with notified interest rate.
deposits.interest_rate_optional: Interest rate optional if not tracking income.

vehicle_info.car: Assuming 12,000 km/year and no accident history for cars.
vehicle_info.two_wheeler: Assuming 6,000 km/year and no accident history for two-wheelers.
vehicle_info.commercial: Assuming 25,000 km/year and no accident history for commercial vehicles.

nps.tier_info: Add both Tier 1 and Tier 2 in one go. Each tier will be saved separately.
nps.expected_return_info: Suggested Expected CAGR for NPS: {{percent}}% (blended default). Tap magic to apply.
nps.annuity_purchase_info: Per PFRDA, minimum annuity purchase at exit is {{percent}}% of corpus. Early exit before age 60 typically requires 80% annuity.
nps.annuity_rate_info: Typical annuity rates are ~6%8% p.a. Adjust based on the insurer/scheme you intend to select.

income.nudge_text: Want to track income against an asset?

payable.title: Add payable
payable.nudge_main: Want to track payments tied to a loan or credit line? Use the Add Liability flow instead.
payable.nudge_desc: Payables are best for standalone bills, subscriptions, taxes and fees that are not part of a liability.

liability.title: Add a liability
liability.asset_nudge: Want to track an asset with a linked loan?
liability.review_date_info: Used to remind you to renew OD/LOC with the bank; safe to leave blank.
liability.facility_info_text1: Line of Credit (LOC) and Overdraft (OD) are revolving facilities with a sanctioned limit. You draw, repay, and redraw within the limit. Interest is charged only on the utilized amount and usually debited monthly.
liability.facility_info_text2: LOC: General-purpose revolving limit (secured or unsecured). Good for flexible cash flow.
liability.facility_info_text3: Overdraft: Often linked to current/savings accounts; similar mechanics. Some products have interest-only servicing with flexible principal repayment.
liability.facility_info_text4: Pick either based on how your NBFC/bank labels the facility. This app tracks snapshot metrics like limit, outstanding, APR, utilization, and renewal reminders.

category_notes.taxfree_psu: Tax-Free PSU Bonds. Interest exempt from income tax. Typically 5.5-8.5% yield.

finance_hub.schemes_browse_helper: Browse govt-backed savings and pension schemes. Tap any scheme to view details and open the calculator when available.

finance_hub.fraud_immediate_desc: If you have just noticed an unauthorized transaction, every minute counts. Follow these steps immediately.
finance_hub.fraud_step1_desc: Use your bank's mobile app or SMS codes to block Debit/Credit cards and Netbanking access immediately.
finance_hub.fraud_step2_desc: Call 1930 or log on to cybercrime.gov.in. Keep your transaction details (UTR/Ref No) ready.
finance_hub.fraud_step3_desc: Inform your bank's fraud department within 3 days. This is critical for RBI's 'Zero Liability' protection.
finance_hub.fraud_zero_liability_desc: If you report an unauthorized transaction within 3 working days, you have zero liability. The bank must credit the amount back within 10 days.
finance_hub.fraud_limited_liability_desc: If reported within 4-7 working days, your liability is limited (usually up to 5,000 to 25,000 depending on account type).
finance_hub.fraud_tip1: Enable SMS and Email alerts for all transactions.
finance_hub.fraud_tip2: Set transaction limits for online and international usage.
finance_hub.fraud_tip3: Never share OTP, PIN, or CVV with anyone calling as 'Bank Staff'.
finance_hub.know_your_rights_desc: Summaries of key RBI guidelines protecting you
finance_hub.rules_disclaimer: These summaries are for informational purposes based on research. For legal purposes, please refer to the official Master Directions on the RBI website.
finance_hub.kyc_header_note: Research-backed list of Officially Valid Documents (OVDs) as per RBI Master Directions.
finance_hub.kyc_important_note: Important: If your current address is different from Aadhaar, you can submit "Deemed OVDs" but must update Aadhaar within 3 months.
finance_hub.security_tips_header: How to stay safe from common digital banking scams and phishing attempts.
finance_hub.security_alert_desc: If you have clicked on a suspicious link or shared details, immediately block your cards and inform your bank using the official channels provided in the Finance Hub.

tax_hub.title: Tax Hub
tax_hub.home_desc: CA-grade guidance, deductions finder, and regime recommendation.

hero.title: CA-grade Tax Guidance
hero.body: Answer a few questions. We will surface deductions, compliance flags, and recommend the best regime at the end.
hero.tax_year_note: We use Tax Year terminology. FY still applies for many documents and employer proofs.

housing.title: Housing (HRA + Home Loan + Rent)
housing.subtitle: Decision assistant: what you can claim and what proofs you need.

deductions.title: Deductions Finder
deductions.subtitle: Find missed deductions and headroom across common sections. (Only for old regime)

full_wizard.title: Full Tax Wizard
full_wizard.subtitle: End-to-end flow with regime recommendation at the end.

tax_housing.title: Housing Assistant
tax_housing.hero_body: Answer a few questions. We will tell you what you can claim (HRA/24(b)/80GG) and what documents you should keep.

q.receives_hra: Do you receive HRA in salary?
q.city_type: Is your work city a metro?
q.home_loan: Do you have a home loan?
q.owns_property: Do you own any house property?
q.home_location: Is your owned home in the same city as your work?

more.landlord_pan: Landlord PAN available (if rent above threshold)

results.title: Your housing claims summary
results.subtitle: This is a for informational purposes only. Keep proofs and follow employer/ITR rules.

claims.hra_exempt_note: Exemption is min of: HRA received, % of salary, rent minus 10% salary.
claims.24b_note_self: Self-occupied: commonly capped at 2,00,000 (subject to conditions).
claims.24b_note_letout: Let-out/deemed let-out: rules differ; interest may be allowed but check set-off limits.
claims.80gg_note: Requires Form 10BA and conditions. Often capped (e.g., up to 60k/yr in simplified view).
claims.hra_zero_note: Rent paid is not more than 10% of salary, so exemption becomes 0.

hra_ok.title: HRA claim looks applicable
hra_ok.body: Keep rent proofs and ensure salary components and city type are accurate.

80gg_check.title: Check 80GG eligibility
80gg_check.body: 80GG is only when you do not receive HRA. Additional conditions apply (including Form 10BA).

80gg_blocked.title: 80GG likely not allowed
80gg_blocked.body: If you/family own a house in the city of work, 80GG is generally not available. Verify conditions before claiming.

24b_self.title: Home loan interest (self-occupied)
24b_self.body: Interest deduction is typically capped; keep interest certificate from lender.

24b_letout.title: Home loan interest (let-out/deemed let-out)
24b_letout.body: Rules differ for let-out property; keep rent details and consult set-off limits.

hra_24b_same_city.title: HRA + home loan in same city
hra_24b_same_city.body: Can be allowed in genuine cases (e.g., owned house far from work), but tends to have higher scrutiny. Keep strong documentation.

hra_24b_diff_city.title: HRA + home loan (different city)
hra_24b_diff_city.body: Usually legitimate to claim both if you work/rent in one city and own a home in another (subject to facts).

rent_relative.title: Rent paid to relative
rent_relative.body: Allowed in many cases if genuine, but keep rent agreement, bank trail, and ensure the recipient reports income.

rent_agreement.title: No rent agreement
rent_agreement.body: If possible, keep a rent agreement and payment proofs to support your claim.

landlord_pan.title: Landlord PAN may be required
landlord_pan.body: For higher rents, employers/ITR may require landlord PAN or a declaration. Keep details ready.

hra_zero.body: Your rent paid is not more than 10% of your salary (Basic + DA), so the HRA exemption component becomes zero.
hra_zero.title: HRA exemption is 0 for these inputs

proofs.title: Documents to keep
proofs.landlord_pan: Landlord PAN / declaration if PAN not available

tax_deductions.title: Deductions Finder
tax_deductions.hero_title: Find missed deductions and headroom. (Only for old regime)
tax_deductions.hero_body: Enter what you have already claimed. We will show remaining headroom and an approximate tax saving (Old regime).

q.rent_no_hra: Do you pay rent but do not receive HRA?

tax_deductions.note_old_regime: Most deductions (80C/80D/24(b)/80TTA etc.) apply only in the Old regime. This tool focuses on Old regime planning.
tax_deductions.note_advanced: Advanced deductions often have eligibility conditions and proofs. Treat this as a checklist, not tax advice.

amount.estimated_taxable: Estimated taxable income (Old regime, before extra deductions)

results.title: Your deductions headroom
results.subtitle: Estimated savings uses a simplified marginal rate (includes 4% cess).

opportunities.title: Top opportunities
opportunities.subtitle: Highest potential tax saving based on remaining headroom (approx).
opportunities.none: No obvious headroom found in the sections you entered.

80d.title: 80D (health insurance)
80d.cap_note: Caps vary by age and parents coverage.

80g.title: Donations (80G)
80g.cap_note: Depends on donation category and limits.

80e.title: Education loan interest (80E)
80e.cap_note: No cap, but eligibility rules apply.

tax_cg_pro.title: Capital Gains
tax_cg_pro.hero_body: Pick the asset type and enter your buy/sell values. We will estimate tax and flag common compliance items (especially for foreign / RSU / ESOP).

q.re_acquired_before: Was the property acquired before July 2024?
q.perquisite_paid: Was perquisite tax already paid (RSU/ESOP vesting)?

tax_cg_pro.foreign_note: Foreign assets and RSU/ESOP transactions can trigger extra disclosures. Keep broker statements and tax documents ready.

results.title: Capital gains summary
results.subtitle: This is a simplified estimate. Actual tax may vary based on asset classification, rates, and disclosures.

flags.title: Compliance flags
flags.none: No additional compliance flags detected for the selected asset type.

fa.title: Schedule FA / foreign disclosures
fa.body: Foreign stocks/RSUs may require reporting in Schedule FA and other disclosures depending on residency and holdings.

perq.title: RSU/ESOP perquisite tax
perq.body: For RSU/ESOP, ensure you are not double-counting: perquisite tax at vesting is separate from capital gains tax at sale.

re_index.title: Indexation choice
re_index.body: If acquired before July 2024, you may have a choice between 12.5% (no indexation) and 20% (with indexation) depending on rules. Compare both.

summary.empty: No items added yet. Calculate a case and tap Add to summary.
summary.title: Capital gains summary

wizard.perquisite_hint: Include the taxable value of stocks (FMV - Exercise Price) as reported in Form 16.
wizard.own_home_question: Do you own a home in the same city?
wizard.show_advanced: Show Other Deductions (EV, Political, Disability, etc.)
wizard.80eeb: EV Loan Interest (80EEB - Sanctioned by Mar 2023)
wizard.validation_income_missing: Add at least one income amount to continue.
wizard.validation_salary_missing: Add at least one salary value (Basic, allowance, HRA, employer NPS, or perquisites) to continue.
wizard.validation_business_mode: Select a business mode to continue.
wizard.capital_gains_note: Use the Capital Gains calculator to estimate tax on STCG/LTCG. Enter that tax here to include it in your total.

flags.cg_body: Capital gains tax depends on asset type, holding period, indexation/thresholds and exemptions. Keep supporting documents and ensure the CG calculation matches your actual transactions.
flags.hra_zero_body: Usually happens when rent paid is not more than 10% of salary considered for HRA, or required inputs are missing. Verify rent and salary breakup.

tax.insight_44ad_body: Gross receipts seem above 2 Cr. Presumptive taxation under 44AD may not be applicable. Consider Regular (Profit) or consult a CA.
tax.insight_44ada_body: Gross receipts seem above 75 L. Presumptive taxation under 44ADA may not be applicable. Consider Regular (Profit) or consult a CA.
tax.insight_80c_body: You still have about {{amt}} available under 80C (PPF/EPF/ELSS/LIC/home loan principal).
tax.insight_80d_cap_parents_body: You entered {{amt}} under 80D (Parents). Limit is 25,000 (50,000 if parents are senior citizens).
tax.insight_80d_cap_self_body: You entered {{amt}} under 80D (Self/Family). For most non-senior cases, the limit is 25,000 (higher limits may apply for senior citizens / preventive check-up).
tax.insight_80gg_body: You are paying rent but not receiving HRA. You might be eligible for deduction under Section 80GG (up to 60k/year).
tax.insight_80ggc_body: Donations to registered political parties are 100% tax-deductible under Section 80GGC (Old Regime).
tax.insight_80tta_body: Based on savings interest, you may claim up to {{amt}} deduction under 80TTA/80TTB (depending on age).
tax.insight_breakeven_body: Roughly, if you can claim ~{{amt}} more eligible deductions (Old regime), Old may become better than New for your case.
tax.insight_employer_nps_body: Employer NPS usually has a % cap of salary (commonly 10% for private sector; different for govt). You entered {{amt}} vs basic {{basic}}. Verify your Form 16 / salary structure.
tax.insight_ev_body: Note: Section 80EEB only applies to EV loans sanctioned between April 1, 2019, and March 31, 2023. New purchases today are generally not eligible for this deduction.
tax.insight_hra_loan_body: Claiming both HRA and Home Loan interest for the same city is legally risky unless you can prove your own home is not fit for living or is far from your workplace.
tax.insight_hra_loan_title: HRA & Home Loan in Same City
tax.insight_hra_low_body: Your HRA exemption is ~{{amt}}. Double-check rent receipts, city type, and that you are using the correct basic/DA components.
tax.insight_nps_body: You may claim up to 50,000 under 80CCD(1B) (NPS). Remaining headroom: {{amt}}.
tax.insight_reco_new: New Regime looks better for your current inputs because your eligible deductions are relatively low.
tax.insight_reco_old: Old Regime looks better because your eligible deductions significantly reduce taxable income.
tax.insight_reco_same: Old and New regimes are close for your inputs. Choose based on how confident you are about maintaining deductions.

proofs.ais_tis: AIS/TIS cross-check for reported gains & TDS
proofs.cg_contract_notes: Capital gains statements / contract notes / sale deed (as applicable)

capital_gains.note_slab_rate: * Taxed at your applicable Income Tax Slab rate.
capital_gains.note_other_ltcg_no_indexation: * Calculated at 12.5% (No Indexation) as per Budget 2024.
capital_gains.note_cess: * Cess of 4% included in tax estimate.

salary.title: Salary Calculator
salary.note_tax_estimate: * Tax estimated using New Regime FY24-25 slabs with 75k Standard Deduction. Actual tax may vary based on 80C/80D inv.

gratuity.title: Gratuity Calculator
gratuity.not_eligible_body: Minimum 5 years of continuous service is required.
gratuity.note_tax_limit: * Tax exemption limit is 20 Lakhs lifetime. If you have claimed gratuity exemption before, this amount reduces.

od_flexi.title: OD / Flexi Loan
od_flexi.savings_sentence: You could save {{amount}} in interest by choosing the Flexi/OD option with {{util}}% utilization compared to a standard Term Loan.
od_flexi.note_term_loan: * Standard Term Loan assumes Reducing Balance EMI on full limit.
od_flexi.note_flexi: * Interest-Only Flexi assumes you pay interest monthly on utilized amount and principal at end/will.
od_flexi.note_dropline: * Drop-line OD assumes limit reduces monthly, and you maintain utilization % of the available limit.
od_flexi.assumption_start_date: Assumption: Start date is {{date}} (1st of next month) for daily interest calculation.
od_flexi.error_opening_gt_limit: Opening outstanding cannot be greater than the sanctioned limit.
od_flexi.error_amt_gt_limit_or_opening: Amount cannot be greater than the sanctioned limit (or opening outstanding, if limit is not provided).
od_flexi.error_months_gt_tenure: Value cannot be greater than the provided tenure.
od_flexi.error_event_month_gt_tenure: Event month cannot be greater than the provided tenure.
od_flexi.error_enter_valid_interest_only: Interest-only months must be between 0 and tenure months.
od_flexi.error_enter_valid_completed_months: Completed tenure months must be between 0 and tenure months.
od_flexi.insights_subtitle: Apply suggestions to improve your plan

balance_transfer.title: Balance Transfer
balance_transfer.break_even_desc: It will take {{months}} months of EMI savings to recover the processing fees.

buy_vs_rent.title: Buy vs Rent
buy_vs_rent.note_buy: * Buy: Pays EMI {{emi}}/mo. Property grows at {{rate}}%.

fd.payout_count_tooltip: Bank payout dates can vary by institution. Many private banks (e.g., HDFC, ICICI) calculate interest by anniversary cycles (for example, 20th  20th). Some banks align payouts to month-end (30th/31st), in which case your first payout may include "broken-period" interest for the partial period (for example, Jan 20  Jan 31) before regular payouts begin.
fd.title: Fixed Deposits
fd.custom_bank_fd: Custom Bank/Corporate FD. Set payout/tenure/rate as needed.
fd.note_pomis: Post Office Monthly Income Scheme. Monthly payout; principal at 5 years.
fd.note_cumulative: Monthly compounding assumed for cumulative FD
fd.payout_rate_hint: Tip: Use the banks payout rate for monthly/quarterly/yearly options. Reinvestment (cumulative) rates will differ.
fd.compounding_locked_hint: Compounding is preset by the selected scheme.
fd.anchor_note_month_start: First payout is prorated from start date to the 1st of next month.
fd.helper_notes: Notes: For payout FDs, interest is paid out periodically and principal is returned at maturity. For cumulative FDs, interest is compounded and paid at maturity. Inflation adjustment is shown only for maturity-only payouts.
fd.multiplier_copy: For every 1 you locked in, the bank added more by maturity. That is the advantage of fixed deposits.
fd.multiplier_title: The Multiplier Effect on your FD
fd.start_date_assumed_booking_note: Start date is assumed as the 1st of next month to align with typical bank FD booking and payout schedules.
fd.payout_start_date_autoset_note: Payout start date is auto-set to the 1st of next month to align with typical bank month-end payout schedules.
fd.validation_inflation_cap: Inflation cannot be more than 10%. Higher assumptions make long-term comparisons unstable.
fd.validation_principal_cap: Deposit amount cannot be more than 100 crores. Larger tickets are uncommon for retail FDs and can distort projections.
fd.validation_rate_cap: Annual interest rate cannot be more than 20%. Higher rates are rare for safe bank/corporate deposits.
fd.validation_term_cap: Term cannot be more than 25 years. Most FD products are much shorter and very long tenures become unrealistic.
fd.scheme_nudge_subtitle: Tap to read official details, eligibility, and rules

rd.title: Recurring Deposits
rd.note_custom: Set your own rate and term.
rd.helper_notes: Notes: RD assumes monthly contributions. Post Office RD credits interest quarterly. In India, most banks usually compound/credit RD interest quarterly. Growth view shows deposits each month and interest credited at the appropriate cadence.
rd.multiplier_copy: For every 1 you deposited, the bank added more in interest. That is the power of disciplined recurring saving.
rd.multiplier_title: The Multiplier Effect on your RD
rd.validation_deposit_cap: Monthly deposit cannot be more than 1 crore. Such large recurring deposits are uncommon for retail RDs.
rd.validation_rate_cap: Annual interest rate cannot be more than 20%. Higher rates are rare for safe recurring deposits.
rd.validation_target_cap: Target maturity cannot be more than 100 crores. Extremely large targets can make RD projections misleading.
rd.validation_term_cap: Term cannot be more than 25 years. Very long RD tenures are unrealistic in practice.

sip.xirr_tooltip: XIRR is the annualized return of your actual cashflows (many SIP payments + final maturity). It can differ slightly from the assumed return due to contribution timing and step-ups.
sip.adv_subtitle: These options fine-tune how calculations are performed.
sip.adv_hint_annuity: If on, each contribution starts earning immediately.
sip.adv_hint_stepup: Linear: base  (1 + n%). Off: compounded per event.
sip.adv_hint_rate: If on, monthly rate = (1+EAR)^(1/12) - 1. If off, APR/12.
sip.adv_annuity_due: Contribute at start of period (Annuity Due)
sip.adv_stepup_linear: Percent step-up is linear on base (not compounded)
sip.adv_rate_effective: Interpret annual rate as Effective Annual (EAR)
sip.inflation_hint: Enable to see purchasing power after inflation.
sip.disclaimer: Returns shown are hypothetical and subject to market conditions.
sip.add_sip_day_tip: Add SIP day for better tracking
sip.chart_cost_of_delay_caption: Delaying your SIP by 5 years reduces your final corpus dramatically. The gap below shows how much wealth you leave on the table.
sip.chart_power_of_compounding_caption: In the early years most of the value is what you invest. After year 810, the interest portion starts to dominate and the curve bends upwards.
sip.lumpsum_cap_toast: Each lump sum cannot exceed 10 crore.
sip.lumpsum_month_term_helper: Month cannot be greater than the investment term.
sip.lumpsum_month_term_toast: Lump sum month cannot be greater than the investment term.

swp.title: Systematic Withdrawal Plan
swp.chart_breakeven_message_hit: By year {{year}}, you have withdrawn your entire initial capital. Anything left after that is pure profit.
swp.chart_breakeven_message_not_hit: Within this term, you do not fully withdraw your initial capital.
swp.chart_sustainability_message_depleted: At this withdrawal rate, your funds run out around year {{year}}.
swp.chart_sustainability_message_safe: At this withdrawal rate, your capital stays intact for the full term.
swp.withdrawal_gt_corpus_helper: Withdrawal cannot be greater than initial corpus.
swp.stepup_amount_gt_corpus_helper: Change amount cannot be greater than initial corpus.
swp.one_time_month_term_helper: Month cannot be greater than the selected term.
swp.one_time_amount_cap_helper: Amount cannot be greater than initial corpus or 100 crore.
swp.one_time_fix_errors_toast: Fix errors in one-time withdrawals before saving.

ppf.title: Public Provident Fund
ppf.validation_annual_min: PPF allows a minimum contribution of 500 per financial year (including top-up).
ppf.validation_annual_max: PPF allows a maximum contribution of 1,50,000 per financial year (including top-up).
ppf.validation_term_min: Minimum PPF lock-in period is 15 years.
ppf.validation_term_block: PPF extensions must be in blocks of 5 years (15, 20, 25, 30...).
ppf.helper_notes: Notes: PPF allows flexible contributions during the year; interest is credited annually. This tool shows projected maturity and growth. Tenure default is 15 years.
ppf.inflation_chart_caption: The blue bar shows what your maturity is worth in today's money.
ppf.inflation_chart_hint: Turn ON inflation to see its impact on your maturity.
ppf.multiplier_copy: For every 1 you saved, the Govt added 2. That is the power of tax-free compounding!
ppf.multiplier_title: The Multiplier Effect on your savings
ppf.multiplier_x_label: Approx. x{{x}} multiplier on your savings

bond.title: Bonds
bond.helper_notes: Price is present value of coupons and redemption discounted at the yield. Semi-annual/quarterly compounds adjust coupon and discounting accordingly.
bond.solve_question: What do you want to find?
bond.helper_enter_ytm: Enter YTM to compute bond price.
bond.helper_clean_dirty: Dirty price = Clean price + Accrued interest. If your quote excludes accrued interest, choose Clean.
bond.helper_dirty_no_extra: Dirty price already includes accrued interest. No extra inputs needed.
bond.accrued_interest_help: Accrued interest is the coupon earned since the last coupon date.
bond.error_settlement_before_last_coupon: Settlement date cannot be before last coupon date.
bond.chart_income_caption: Annual cashflows (coupons + redemption) over bond life

nps.title: National Pension Scheme
nps.helper_small_corpus_applied: Small-corpus exemption applied ( {{amount}}). Minimum annuity not required.
nps.adv_stepup_employer: Apply annual step-up to employer contribution
nps.info_expected_return: Expected Return is a long-term blended assumption based on your chosen profile and historical NPS ranges. You can adjust it anytime. The magic icon resets to the default (10%).
nps.helper_rules: Notes: NPS Tier I follows PFRDA rules. Minimum annuity purchase applies at retirement (e.g., 40% at 60). Small-corpus exemption allows full withdrawal if corpus is under the threshold.
nps.error_age_order: Retirement age must be greater than current age.
nps.suggested_default: Suggested: {{percent}}% p.a. (blended default). Tap magic to apply.
nps.chart_power_caption: Employee + Employer + Top-up vs Interest over time
nps.entry_age_error: Entry age must be between 18 and 70 years.
nps.helper_intermediate_slab: Corpus is in 8L12L slab: 6L lump sum, remaining for annuity/withdrawal.
nps.premature_min_years_error: Premature exit (before 60) requires at least 5 years in the scheme.
nps.retire_age_max_error: Retirement age cannot be more than 75 years.

epf.title: Employees Provident Fund
epf.helper_notes: Notes: EPF contributions include Employee, VPF and Employer (EPF/EPS). EPS goes to pension and does not form part of the EPF corpus. Interest is credited annually; this tool approximates monthly accrual with year-end credit.

apy.title: Govt Pension Schemes
apy.info_text: APY tables are defined by PFRDA. We look up the nearest entry-age row for the selected pension slab. Actual official table is discrete by age; for precise values, refer to your banks APY matrix.
apy.error_age_range: Entry age must be between {{min}} and {{max}} years.

scss.title: Senior Citizen Savings Scheme
scss.info_text: SCSS pays interest quarterly at the notified rate. This tool estimates quarterly payout as principal  annual rate / 4. Monthly income is a rough guide (principal  annual rate / 12) for planning only.

ssy.title: Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana
ssy.annual_cap_error: Maximum per year: You cannot deposit more than 1.5 Lakh in a financial year. Any amount over this will be returned without interest.
ssy.timeline_helper_invalid: Account timeline: Deposits allowed for the first 15 years. Growth-only period: years 1621 (no deposits). Maturity: end of year 21.
ssy.timeline_helper: Account timeline: Deposits allowed for the first {{depositYears}} years. Growth-only period: years {{growthFromYear}}{{maturityYear}} (no deposits). Maturity: end of year {{maturityYear}}.
ssy.lockin_helper_main: Lock-in: Partial withdrawal is allowed when she turns 18 (subject to rules). Maturity is at 21 years from opening.
ssy.lockin_helper_early: Opening earlier means a longer lock-in, but also more years for compounding before she turns 18.
ssy.lockin_helper_edge: Because you are opening around age 10, the lock-in is only about 8 years until she turns 18.
ssy.lockin_helper_error: You can open an SSY account only up to 10 years of age.
ssy.info_calculated_fields_desc: Total Interest and Total at Maturity.

hlv.adequate: You appear adequately covered based on these inputs.
hlv.tenure: Tenure: cover till your retirement (about {{years}} years).
hlv.checklist_1: Pick a reputed insurer + high claim settlement consistency.
hlv.checklist_2: Declare medical history honestly (PED/non-disclosure risks claims).

hlv.consider_buying: Consider buying a Term Insurance plan for {{amount}}.

health.base_vs_topup: Base policy handles regular hospital bills; super top-up protects you against rare, high-cost events beyond the deductible.
health.deductible_hint: A common structure: base cover as deductible, then super top-up above it.
health.red_flags_title: Red flags to avoid in policy wording
health.red_flag_1: Room rent limit or sub-limits on common procedures.
health.red_flag_2: Copay clauses (you pay a % of every claim).
health.red_flag_3: Long waiting period for pre-existing diseases (PED).

ulip.insight_term_better: By separating insurance and investment, you get better returns and flexible liquidity.
ulip.insight_ulip_better: In this scenario, the bundled product yields more (check assumptions).
ulip.next_1: Compare lock-in, surrender charges, and fund switching rules before you commit.
ulip.next_2: Ask for an illustration with all charges and use net returns for comparison.
ulip.next_3: Keep insurance (term) and investing (MF) separate for flexibility.

loan.prepayment_validation: Fix errors: Remove duplicate months and enter amounts for each month.

sip_enable_inflation.title: Inflation can materially reduce real outcomes
sip_enable_inflation.body: If this SIP is for a long-term goal, it helps to view the result in today's value. Turning on inflation shows a more realistic (inflation-adjusted) maturity.

sip_add_initial_lumpsum.title: Add an initial lump sum (optional)
sip_add_initial_lumpsum.body: A small initial lump sum can give compounding a head start. Try adding ~{{amount}}.

sip_add_yearly_lumpsum.title: Add a yearly top-up (optional)
sip_add_yearly_lumpsum.body: If you get annual bonus / irregular cashflow, try adding a yearly lump sum of ~{{amount}}.

sip_return_sensitivity.title: Sensitivity to returns (quick range)
sip_return_sensitivity.body: With the same contributions, a small change in return assumption can change outcomes meaningfully. Your maturity moves from ~{{maturity}} to ~{{low}} (lower-return) or ~{{high}} (higher-return).

sip_stepup_impact_on.title: Step-up impact
sip_stepup_impact_on.body: With a step-up of {{stepUpPct}} per year, maturity is ~{{maturity}}. Without step-up (same starting SIP), it would be ~{{noStep}}.

sip_stepup_impact_off.title: Step-up can materially increase outcomes
sip_stepup_impact_off.body: With step-up off, maturity is ~{{maturity}}. In a quick check, adding a yearly step-up can increase maturity by ~{{delta}} (vs no step-up ~{{noStep}}).

sip_timing_impact.title: Contribute earlier in the cycle (if possible)
sip_timing_impact.body: For {{frequency}} contributions, making deposits at the start of the cycle can increase compounding time. In a quick check, maturity improves from ~{{maturity}} to ~{{timingStart}}.

sip_goal_gap.title: Projected maturity is below target
sip_goal_gap.body: Target is ~{{target}} and projected maturity is ~{{maturity}}. To close the gap, you can increase SIP amount, extend the tenure, or enable a yearly step-up.

sip_inflation_goal_uplift.title: Inflation raises the goal amount
sip_inflation_goal_uplift.body: Your goal is ~{{today}} in today's money. With inflation, the implied target at the end of ~{{years}} years is ~{{future}}.

sip_existing_corpus_dominates.title: Most contribution is coming from existing corpus
sip_existing_corpus_dominates.body: You added an initial lump sum of ~{{lumpSum}}. Only ~{{sipSharePct}}% of total contributions are coming via SIP. If you want the plan to rely more on periodic investing, consider increasing the SIP amount or enabling step-up.

sip_real_value_drop.title: Real (inflation-adjusted) value is much lower
sip_real_value_drop.body: Nominal maturity is ~{{maturity}}, but in today's money it's ~{{maturityAdj}}. Consider increasing SIP / step-up or reviewing the goal in real terms.

sip_tax_enable.title: Enable taxation for post-tax insights
sip_tax_enable.body: Turn on Taxation in Settings to see an estimated post-tax maturity (capital gains) and the tax drag on returns.

sip_tax_post_tax_maturity.title: Estimated post-tax maturity (capital gains)
sip_tax_post_tax_maturity.body: Assuming Equity MF {{hold}}{{exempt}}: gains ~{{gain}}, taxable gains ~{{taxableGain}}, tax ~{{tax}} at ~{{rate}}%. Maturity ~{{maturity}} (post-tax ~{{postTax}}).

sip_tax_drag.title: Tax drag on gains
sip_tax_drag.body: Estimated tax could reduce your gains by ~{{drag}}% (Equity MF {{hold}}).

bond_enable_inflation.title: Enable inflation (real yield)
bond_enable_inflation.body: Inflation reduces real returns. Turn on inflation to see the inflation-adjusted (real) yield/return.

sgb_total_return_context.title: What is driving your SGB outcome
sgb_total_return_context.body: Over ~{{years}} years, your estimate totals ~{{totalValue}} on an investment of ~{{invested}}.

sgb_coupon_share.title: Coupons are a smaller part of SGB returns
sgb_coupon_share.body: In your projection, coupons contribute ~{{totalCoupons}} (~{{couponSharePct}}% of total value). Most of the outcome comes from gold price movement. If gold CAGR is uncertain for your horizon, re-check the CAGR input and view the range.

sgb_real_return.title: Projected return may not beat inflation
sgb_real_return.body: With inflation at ~{{infl}}%, your estimated annualized return is ~{{effCagrPct}}% (real ~{{real}}%). Consider whether your gold CAGR assumption fits your goal horizon, or run a lower-CAGR scenario.

bond_current_yield_vs_ytm.title: Cash yield vs total return (YTM) can diverge
bond_current_yield_vs_ytm.body: Your annual coupon cashflow is ~{{couponCashPerYear}}. That is ~{{currentYieldPct}}% of the clean price, while YTM is ~{{ytmPct}}%. If current yield is higher than YTM, part of your return is offset by buying at a premium; if lower, YTM relies more on price appreciation to face value by maturity.

bond_premium.title: You are paying a premium to face value
bond_premium.body: Your clean price (~{{clean}}) is ~{{premiumPct}}% above face (~{{face}}). If you hold to maturity you still redeem at face; the premium is recovered via lower total return (YTM) vs coupon rate. If you may sell before maturity, a yield rise can compress the premium faster.

bond_discount.title: You are buying below face value
bond_discount.body: Your clean price (~{{clean}}) is ~{{discountPct}}% below face (~{{face}}). Part of your YTM comes from pull-to-par (price moving towards face value) if held to maturity.

bond_yield_sensitivity.title: Price sensitivity to yield changes
bond_yield_sensitivity.body: If market yield moves by 0.50%, the estimated dirty price shifts from ~{{baseDirty}} to ~{{up}} (higher yield) or ~{{down}} (lower yield). If you may sell before maturity, this is the primary risk to plan for.

bond_accrued_interest.title: Accrued interest affects what you actually pay
bond_accrued_interest.body: Your accrued interest is ~{{ai}}. Even if you quote a clean price, settlement typically happens at dirty price (clean + accrued). If you are comparing deals, compare dirty prices on the same settlement date.

bond_real_yield.title: Inflation may erase most of the real yield
bond_real_yield.body: With inflation at ~{{infl}}%, your approximate real yield is ~{{real}}%/yr (YTM ~{{ytmPct}}%). If this is a long-term goal, consider whether you need some growth allocation alongside the bond bucket.

fd_high_rate.title: FD rate looks unusually high
fd_high_rate.body: You entered {{r}}%. Typical median for this tenure is ~{{median}}%. If this is a small finance/NBFC issuer, check credit rating, DICGC coverage, and lock-in terms.

fd_low_rate.title: FD rate looks low vs market
fd_low_rate.body: You entered {{r}}%. Typical median for this tenure is ~{{median}}%. You may be leaving returns on the tablecompare rates across banks for the same tenure and payout type.

fd_inflation_warning.title: Inflation may wipe out real returns
fd_inflation_warning.body: With inflation at ~{{infl}}%, your real return is roughly ~{{real}}%/yr before tax. Consider whether this FD is for safety/liquidity vs growth.

fd_post_tax_yield.title: Post-tax FD yield is what matters
fd_post_tax_yield.body: At {{r}}% nominal, your estimated post-tax yield is ~{{postTax}}%/yr using slab {{slab}}%{{assumption}}{{regime}}.

fd_post_tax_real_negative.title: Post-tax returns may not beat inflation
fd_post_tax_real_negative.body: With inflation at ~{{infl}}%, your post-tax real return is roughly ~{{postTaxReal}}%/yr. Consider whether you need more growth-oriented instruments for long-term goals.

fd_taxable.title: FD interest is taxable
fd_taxable.body: FD interest is generally taxed as per your income slab (TDS may apply based on thresholds).{{regime}} Factor post-tax returns when comparing to alternatives.{{assumption}}

fd_tax_enable.title: Enable taxation for accurate post-tax yield
fd_tax_enable.body: Turn on Taxation in Settings to compute post-tax returns using your slab (instead of a generic assumption).

rd_rate_context.title: RD rate context
rd_rate_context.body: For ~{{years}} years (using FD market bands as proxy): {{context}}.

rd_high_rate.title: RD rate looks unusually high
rd_high_rate.body: You entered {{r}}%. Typical median for this tenure is ~{{median}}%. If this is a small finance/NBFC issuer, check credit rating, withdrawal rules, and lock-in terms.

rd_low_rate.title: RD rate looks low vs market
rd_low_rate.body: You entered {{r}}%. Typical median for this tenure is ~{{median}}%. Consider comparing rates across banks for the same tenure and compounding frequency.

rd_inflation_warning.title: Inflation may wipe out real returns
rd_inflation_warning.body: With inflation at ~{{infl}}%, your real return is roughly ~{{real}}%/yr before tax. RD is great for disciplined saving, but dont expect strong real growth at low spreads.

rd_post_tax_yield.title: Post-tax RD yield is what matters
rd_post_tax_yield.body: At {{r}}% nominal, your estimated post-tax yield is ~{{postTax}}%/yr using slab {{slab}}%{{assumption}}{{regime}}.

rd_post_tax_real_negative.title: Post-tax returns may not beat inflation
rd_post_tax_real_negative.body: With inflation at ~{{infl}}%, your post-tax real return is roughly ~{{postTaxReal}}%/yr. Consider whether RD is for discipline/cashflow vs long-term growth.

rd_taxable.title: RD interest is taxable
rd_taxable.body: RD interest is generally taxed as per your income slab.{{regime}} Consider post-tax returns when comparing to alternatives.{{assumption}}

rd_tax_enable.title: Enable taxation for accurate post-tax yield
rd_tax_enable.body: Turn on Taxation in Settings to compute post-tax returns using your slab (instead of a generic assumption).

ppf_enable_inflation.title: Enable inflation (real value)
ppf_enable_inflation.body: Inflation reduces real purchasing power. Turn on inflation to view maturity value in today's money.

ppf_lock_in.title: Lock-in is long
ppf_lock_in.body: PPF is typically locked for ~{{lockIn}} years. A {{term}}-year horizon may not match the product rules and liquidity constraints.

ppf_extension_blocks_aligned.title: Extension planning after maturity
ppf_extension_blocks_aligned.body: You selected ~{{term}} years. After the initial ~{{lockIn}}-year lock-in, PPF extensions are typically in 5-year blocks. Your horizon aligns (~{{extra}} years  {{blocks}} blocks).

ppf_extension_blocks_unaligned.title: Extension planning after maturity
ppf_extension_blocks_unaligned.body: You selected ~{{term}} years. After the initial ~{{lockIn}}-year lock-in, PPF extensions are typically in 5-year blocks. Consider aligning to 5-year blocks after maturity for cleaner planning.

ppf_annual_cap.title: Annual contribution cap
ppf_annual_cap.body: PPF annual contribution is typically capped at ~{{maxAnnual}}. Your planned annual contribution (~{{annual}}) exceeds this cap.

ppf_cap_util_low.title: You are using a small part of the annual limit
ppf_cap_util_low.body: Your planned annual contribution is ~{{annual}}, which is ~{{utilPct}}% of the typical PPF annual cap (~{{maxAnnual}}). If your goal is long-term, tax-free compounding, consider increasing contributions (subject to cashflow).

ppf_cap_util_high.title: Good use of PPF annual limit
ppf_cap_util_high.body: Your planned annual contribution is ~{{annual}} (~{{utilPct}}% of the typical cap ~{{maxAnnual}}). This helps you benefit more from tax-free compounding.

ppf_inflation_warning.title: Inflation may reduce real growth
ppf_inflation_warning.body: With inflation at ~{{infl}}%, real return is roughly ~{{real}}%/yr. PPF is great for stability and tax efficiency, but may not build strong real wealth at low spreads.

ppf_tax_eee.title: Tax treatment is EEE
ppf_tax_eee.body: PPF is typically EEE: contributions (within limits), interest, and maturity proceeds are generally tax-free.

ssy_enable_inflation.title: Enable inflation (real value)
ssy_enable_inflation.body: Inflation reduces real purchasing power. Turn on inflation to view maturity value in today's money.

ssy_maturity_context.title: Maturity timeline
ssy_maturity_context.body: SSY typically matures in ~{{maturityYears}} years from account opening. With girl age ~{{age}}, maturity is around age ~{{maturityAge}}.

ssy_age_18_milestone.title: Age-18 milestone planning
ssy_age_18_milestone.body: Girl is ~{{age}} now. Age 18 is ~{{yearsTo18}} years away. If this is meant for higher education, align contributions and expectations to that milestone (maturity is later).

ssy_cap_util_low.title: You are using a small part of the annual limit
ssy_cap_util_low.body: Your planned annual contribution is ~{{annual}}, which is ~{{utilPct}}% of the typical SSY annual cap (~{{maxAnnual}}). If you want to maximize the tax-free compounding benefit, consider increasing contributions (subject to your cashflow).

ssy_cap_util_high.title: Good use of SSY annual limit
ssy_cap_util_high.body: Your planned annual contribution is ~{{annual}} (~{{utilPct}}% of the typical cap ~{{maxAnnual}}). This helps you benefit more from tax-free compounding.

ssy_annual_cap.title: Annual contribution cap
ssy_annual_cap.body: SSY annual contribution is typically capped at ~{{maxAnnual}}. Your planned annual contribution (~{{annual}}) exceeds this cap.

ssy_inflation_warning.title: Inflation may reduce real growth
ssy_inflation_warning.body: With inflation at ~{{infl}}%, real return is roughly ~{{real}}%/yr. SSY is designed for safety and tax efficiency; consider complementing with higher-growth instruments for long horizons if needed.

ssy_tax_eee.title: Tax treatment is EEE
ssy_tax_eee.body: SSY is typically EEE: contributions (within limits), interest, and maturity proceeds are generally tax-free.

nps_enable_inflation.title: Enable inflation (real value)
nps_enable_inflation.body: Inflation reduces real purchasing power. Turn on inflation to view outcomes in today's money.

nps_return_very_high.title: Return assumption looks aggressive
nps_return_very_high.body: You entered {{r}}%/yr, which is quite high for long-term planning. Consider running a sensitivity check with {{maxRealistic}}% or lower as well.

nps_short_horizon.title: Short horizon increases risk
nps_short_horizon.body: With only ~{{years}} years to retirement, market volatility can materially affect outcomes. Consider conservative assumptions and asset allocation.

nps_return_sensitivity.title: Market-linked sensitivity (quick check)
nps_return_sensitivity.body: A small change in return assumptions can move outcomes meaningfully. In a quick scenario check, your corpus changes from ~{{corpus}} to ~{{low}} (lower-return) or ~{{high}} (higher-return).

nps_small_corpus_exemption.title: Small corpus: full withdrawal likely allowed
nps_small_corpus_exemption.body: Your estimated corpus (~{{corpus}}) is within the small-corpus threshold (~{{threshold}}). Under current rules, full lump-sum withdrawal may be allowed (no mandatory annuity).

nps_intermediate_slab.title: Exit slab may force partial annuity
nps_intermediate_slab.body: Your corpus falls in a slab where rules can force a partial annuity purchase even if you prefer lump sum. Review the lump-sum vs annuity split shown in the result.

nps_lumpsum_context.title: Lump sum vs annuity trade-off
nps_lumpsum_context.body: Your estimated lump sum is ~{{lumpSum}} (out of ~{{corpus}}). Higher annuity purchase increases pension but reduces investable lump sum.

nps_annuity_high.title: High annuity purchase reduces flexibility
nps_annuity_high.body: You are allocating ~{{effectivePct}}% to annuity. This can increase pension but reduces liquidity and lump-sum flexibility.

nps_annuity_tax_note.title: Annuity is typically taxable
nps_annuity_tax_note.body: Annuity income is generally taxable as per slab. You set annuity purchase at {{annPct}}% with annuity rate {{annRate}}%. Factor post-tax pension when planning.

nps_inflation_warning.title: Inflation may erode real wealth
nps_inflation_warning.body: With inflation at ~{{infl}}%, your real return assumption is only ~{{real}}%/yr. For retirement planning, run scenarios with higher inflation / lower returns too.

nps_real_corpus.title: Inflation-adjusted corpus at retirement
nps_real_corpus.body: In today's money, your retirement corpus is ~{{realCorpus}} (after ~{{years}} years). Use this to compare against todays goals/expenses.

epf_enable_inflation.title: Enable inflation (real value)
epf_enable_inflation.body: Inflation reduces real purchasing power. Turn on inflation to view balances in today's money.

epf_rate_sanity_low.title: EPF rate looks unusually low
epf_rate_sanity_low.body: You entered {{r}}%. Double-check if the rate input is annual (not monthly) and whether you used the correct notified rate.

epf_tax_interest_on_excess_contrib.title: Interest may become taxable (employee contribution)
epf_tax_interest_on_excess_contrib.body: Your estimated employee yearly contribution is ~{{employeeAnnualContrib}}. This exceeds the threshold of ~{{threshold}} where interest on excess contributions may become taxable (rules can vary by year and conditions).

epf_inflation_warning.title: Inflation may reduce real growth
epf_inflation_warning.body: With inflation at ~{{infl}}%, real return is roughly ~{{real}}%/yr. EPF is a strong retirement anchor, but inflation still matters for long horizons.

epf_short_horizon.title: Short EPF horizon needs care
epf_short_horizon.body: For a horizon of ~{{years}} years, EPF withdrawals and tax treatment can be rule-dependent. Double-check eligibility conditions before planning early withdrawal.

home_loan_tax_new_regime.title: Home loan tax benefits may not apply (New regime)
home_loan_tax_new_regime.body: {{baseBody}} Under the New tax regime, many deductions are not available. Switch to Old regime in Advanced settings if you want to estimate tax benefit.

home_loan_tax_old_regime.title: Estimated home-loan tax benefit (Old regime)
home_loan_tax_old_regime.body: {{baseBody}} Under the Old regime, interest deduction may apply. Eligible interest considered ~{{eligibleInterest}}{{capNote}}, estimated tax saved ~{{estTaxSaved}}.

loan_rate_unrealistically_low.title: Rate looks unrealistically low
loan_rate_unrealistically_low.body: You entered {{r}}%. For a {{loanType}}, this looks {{why}}. Double-check if this is an introductory rate, a secured product, or if the rate input is monthly vs annual.

loan_high_roi_fallback.title: High interest rate for {{loanType}}
loan_high_roi_fallback.body: Your rate of {{input}}% is higher than the market median of {{median}}%.

loan_tenure_unrealistic_fallback.title: Tenure looks unrealistic
loan_tenure_unrealistic_fallback.body: A tenure of {{input}} years is uncommon for this loan type. Typical max is {{max}} years.

tenure_trap_fallback.title: Tenure increases total interest sharply
tenure_trap_fallback.body: At {{input}} years, you may pay ~{{ratio}}x of principal as interest (depends on rate).

prepayment_opportunity_fallback.title: Small prepayment can save years
prepayment_opportunity_fallback.body: Paying 1 extra EMI/year could reduce tenure by ~{{years_saved}} years.

od_high_utilization.title: High utilization makes OD behave like a term loan
od_high_utilization.body: Your average utilization is ~{{util}}%. When utilization stays high, OD loses its interest-saving advantage. Compare with a standard EMI loan to sanity check cost.

od_near_limit.title: You are close to the limit
od_near_limit.body: Peak utilization is ~{{util}}%. Running near the limit can increase risk of over-limit charges and reduce flexibility. Consider keeping a buffer or increasing repayments.

od_interest_only_trap.title: Interest-only can become a trap
od_interest_only_trap.body: If you only service interest (and dont reduce principal), the outstanding can remain high for the full tenure. Adding even a small fixed monthly repayment can reduce total interest.

od_negative_cashflow.title: Withdrawals exceed deposits
od_negative_cashflow.body: Your monthly withdrawals are higher than deposits/repayment. This tends to increase outstanding over time and can push utilization higher.
